most_active_tickets.title: pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS

common_issues.title: pieces-for-developers crashes on startup on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS
common_issues.description: The application crashes immediately after launch on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS with X11 and Nvidia drivers.  Logs indicate potential XCB multi-threading issues and failure to load GTK modules.  The application's data directory isn't created.  Suggested solutions include checking GTK and XCB library compatibility, ensuring XInitThreads is called if using multi-threading, and verifying Nvidia driver compatibility.

related_issues.title: pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS
related_issues.text:
pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I launch pieces-for-developers a window briefly appears and then disappears. 

The first time after I reboot a blank window appears and Ubuntu displayed the "application not responding" dialog. No matter how many times I clicked "wait" it never appeared to start. I've not been able to reproduce however and now the blank window appears and almost immediately disappears

System is running Ubuntu 24.04 LTS using X11 with nvidia device drivers

pieces-os           12.2.1            (105)   1GB -
pieces-for-developers 4.3.3            (94) 173MB

The `~/.local/share/com.pieces.os` folder does not appear to have been created

Output from when starting with debug flag

```
pieces-for-developers --debug
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.749: Not loading module "atk-bridge": The functionality is provided by GTK natively. Please try to not load it.

(pieces_for_x:12556): Gtk-WARNING **: 08:24:44.845: GTK+ module /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/gnome-platform/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/modules/libcanberra-gtk-module.so cannot be loaded.
GTK+ 2.x symbols detected. Using GTK+ 2.x and GTK+ 3 in the same process is not supported.
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.845: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"

(pieces_for_x:12556): Gtk-WARNING **: 08:24:44.846: GTK+ module /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/gnome-platform/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/modules/libcanberra-gtk-module.so cannot be loaded.
GTK+ 2.x symbols detected. Using GTK+ 2.x and GTK+ 3 in the same process is not supported.
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.846: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
RuntimeFlutterCodeHighlighter initialized with path: /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/lib/libruntime_code_highlighter.so
Debug: Starting logger initialization...
Debug: SimpleLogger configured with Level.ALL
Debug: SimpleLogger formatter configured
Debug: Sentry initialized
Debug: Sentry logger configured
Debug: Log directory initialized at: /home/dns/snap/pieces-for-developers/94/.local/share/com.pieces.os.dependency_management
Debug: About to complete initialization...
Debug: Initialization completed
INFO: [LOGGER::initialized] Logger initialized successfully with updated directory: /home/dns/Documents/com.pieces.pfd/production/logs
[xcb] Unknown sequence number while processing reply
[xcb] Most likely this is a multi-threaded client and XInitThreads has not been called
[xcb] Aborting, sorry about that.
pieces_for_x: ../../src/xcb_io.c:730: _XReply: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_threads_sequence_lost' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the crash on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS with Nvidia drivers and X11 as it blocks users from accessing the application.
Investigate XCB multi-threading issues, GTK module loading failures, and Nvidia driver compatibility on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.
Ensure the application's data directory is created correctly on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.
Add documentation or troubleshooting steps for users experiencing crashes on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, including checks for GTK and XCB library compatibility and XInitThreads usage.
